newsitem.title: DENMARK: POLL-Top Danish banks seen headed for bumper H1.
newsitem.headline: POLL-Top Danish banks seen headed for bumper H1.

text.p: Denmark's four biggest banks are seen headed for record first-half 1997 results this month, boosted by continuing falls in losses and bad debt provisions and solid securities gains.

A poll of nine Danish and international analysts released by Reuters on Friday forecast average rises in profits before tax and extraordinary items of between 27 and 44 percent for the top four banks, compared to the first six months of 1996.

Den Danske Bank, Denmark's leading bank, was seen posting an interim profit before tax and extraordinary items an average 27 percent better than a year ago, with fourth biggest Jyske Bank expected to be 28 percent higher.
The poll saw third biggest BG Bank 39 percent up and second bank Unidanmark 44 percent better.

nine analysts, figures in millions of crowns):
Den Danske Bank (H1 result expected August 21)
